The magnitude of an earthquake is represented by the Richter scale; the intensity by the Mercalli scale. (Source: GUNN)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: earthquake

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: The state of being secure from harm, injury, danger or risk, often as a result of planned measures or preparations. (Source: RHW)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: safety

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: The processes by which magma and its associated gases rise into the crust and are extruded onto the Earth's surface and into the atmosphere. (Source: BJGEO)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: volcanism

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Contamination of rain by atmospheric and soil pollutants.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: pollution of rainwater

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Rain having a pH less than 5.6. The acidity results from chemical reactions occurring when water, sulphur dioxide, and nitrogen oxides, generally released by industrial processes, are chemically transformed into sulphuric and nitric acids.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: acid rain

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: The presence in the air of one or more contaminants in such a concentration and of such duration as to cause a nuisance or to be injurious to human life, animal life or vegetation. (Source: LANDY)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: atmospheric pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: The liquid or solid wastes from farming, including: runoff from pesticides, fertilizers, and feedlots; erosion and dust from plowing; animal manure and carcasses, crop residues, and debris.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: agricultural pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Any goal or target established for a product, service or endeavor that aspires to attain a relatively high grade or level of excellence. (Source: RHW)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: quality objective

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Contamination of soil or groundwater from irrigation, from overuse of de-icing salt, overexploitation of underground water, etc.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: salt pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Placing in or on, or otherwise introducing into or onto waters, or in a position where it is likely to enter waters, any matter, whether solid, liquid or gaseous, so that the physical, chemical or biological condition of the waters is changed.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: water pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Pollution caused by substances of chemical nature, including chlorinated hydrocarbon pesticides, polychlorinated biphenyls, metals as mercury, lead, cadmium, arsenic, etc.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: chemical pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Contamination of water, soil and air with pathogen bacteria.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: bacteriological pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: The presence, release or introduction of polluting substances in or onto the seashore or the land near it. (Source: TOE / DOE / RHW)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: coastal pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Contamination of subsurface water from agricultural, urban, and industrial uses, including fertilizers, pesticides, septic tank systems, street drainage, and air and surface-water pollution.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: groundwater pollution

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: A normal metabolite that, when present in abnormal concentrations in certain body fluids, can indicate the presence of a particular disease or toxicological condition.
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: biomarker

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: A course of action adopted by government or some other organization that determines how to deal with matters involving the cultivation of land; raising crops; feeding, breeding and raising livestock or poultry; and other farming issues. (Source: RHW)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: agricultural policy

www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.definition: Environmental elements of recognized importance which can be modified by the completion of a project. (Source: RRDA)
www.semide.net_portal_thesaurus_Concept_.name: environmental target
